沿革內容:
1.Enacted and promulgated on November Seventh, 2007.
2.Full text (11 articles) has been amended on 29 January 2014 by Presidential Decree Hua- tzung-1 Yi Tzu No. 10300011821 and enforced from the date of promulgation.
3.Article 2 and attached drawings amended and promulgated, Article 9-1 enacted and promulgated, on January 5, 2022.

法規內容.條文內容: The Armed Forces Uniforms are regulated by this Act.

Paragraph 1
For active duty servicemen, there are three kinds of uniforms as follows:
Subparagraph 1
Dress Uniforms; the fashion shall be correspondent to Attached Photo 1.
Subparagraph 2
Garrison Service Uniforms; the fashion shall be correspondent to Attached Photo 2.
Subparagraph 3
Field Service Uniforms; the fashion shall be promulgated by the Ministry of National Defense.
Paragraph 2
Active duty servicemen wearing Dress Uniforms and Garrison Service Uniforms shall wear cockades, cap tassels, and rank insignias; the fashion shall be correspondent to Attached Photo 3. Active duty servicemen wearing Field Service Uniforms shall wear rank insignias; the fashion shall be promulgated by the Ministry of National Defense.
Paragraph 3
The Ministry of National Defense is empowered to promulgate the subject, region, and fashion of other insignias which shall be worn.
Paragraph 4
The uniforms, cockades, cap tassels, and rank insignias of active duty servicemen shall be distinguished among Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, and the Military Police.

Wearing Garrison Service Uniforms on the following occasions:
Subparagraph 1
attending all kinds of military ceremonies;
Subparagraph 2
ordinary working days or outing.
When wearing uniforms, active duty servicemen are required to wear those awarding with decorations, badges, and medals according to relative regulations.

Non-active duty servicemen are entitled to wear the uniforms stipulated by this Act on the following occasions:
Subparagraph 1
servicemen retired or out of commission being invited by the Ministry of National Defense to attend ceremonies;
Subparagraph 2
reservists being promoted;
Subparagraph 3
other circumstances approved by the Ministry of National Defense.

The fashion of fatigue dresses, sweat suits, raincoats, jackets, sweaters, outer coats, maternity clothes, caps, and the clothes for particular missions or comity of nations are promulgated by the Ministry of National Defense and its sub-division.

Paragraph 1
The supply and distribution of uniforms, cockades, cap tassels, rank insignias, other emblems, clothes, underwear, underpants, army socks, army boots for active duty servicemen are stipulated by the Ministry of National Defense; those who are appointed to other agencies may be supplied and distributed via entrusting by the Ministry of National Defense.
Paragraph 2
the provisions of preceding paragraph shall apply mutatis mutandis to the supply and distribution for cadets.

Special purpose uniform items prepared and worn by active duty servicemen due to the needs of their employing agency, unit or assignment may not included in the supply and distribution system, for which allowances shall be disbursed by the service agency of the active duty servicemen instead.
The recipients, criteria, amounts, and manners of allowances disbursement under the preceding paragraph shall be prescribed separately by the Ministry of National Defense and the National Security Bureau.

The circumstances of active duty servicemen to wear uniforms, the switching time for seasonal uniforms, and the occasions Article 3 to Article 5 applied to are promulgated by the Ministry of National Defense.
This Act will be put into practice from the date of promulgation.
